# Critics' Choice Super Award for Best Actor in a Horror Movie

The '''Critics' Choice Super Award for Best Actor in a Horror Movie' is an award presented by the Critics Choice Association to the best performance by an actor in a horror film.
This award was first presented in 2021 to Vince Vaughn for his role as The Blissfield Butcher in Freaky. The most nominated actor in this category is Nicolas Cage with 3 nominations.
The current recipient of the award is Michael B. Jordan for his dual role as Elijah "Smoke" Moore and Elias "Stack" Moore in Sinners.
